intro: Eriophyton wallichii, commonly known as the silver thread plant, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
